title: Static hosting drills
content:
I practiced moving the site between hosts in under an hour. Assets live in a bucket, HTML is portable, and SQLite moves as a single file.

Each drill surfaces one snag DNS TTLs, SSL renewals, or a script that assumed a path. Fixing them ahead of time means real incidents stay boring.

Portability keeps me calm: if a server misbehaves, I redeploy elsewhere and keep rolling.
